intro: Seseli sonderi, commonly known as Sonder's seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or yellowish flowers. Native to specific regions in Turkey, it thrives in rocky and arid environments. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
